problem_text: The common chord A B between \odot P and \odot Q is perpendicular to the segment connecting the centers of the circles. If A B = 10 what is the length of P Q?
comment: very very hard, text logic form is wrong
compact_text: The common chord AB between \odot P and \odot Q is perpendicular to the segment connecting the centers of the circles. If AB = 10 what is the length of PQ?
annotat_text: The common chord $\overline{AB}$ between $\odot P$ and $\odot Q$ is perpendicular to the segment connecting the centers of the circles. If $AB=10$ what is the length of $\overline{PQ}$?
